channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The Cheltenham Run Sunday 21 Sept '25, 9th September
item.description:
The absence of a road closed sign at the junction of Windsor Street and Pittville Crescent Lane allows motor vehicles to emerge into Albert Road on top of the runners. This occurred last year and when speaking to the Run Team they could not understand what was happening as they were confusing Pittville Crescent with Pittville Crescent Lane. This report is my attempt to prevent a repeat occurrence this year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Abandoned road signs, 9th September
item.description:
I'm not sure if these were left by contractors or part of a student house clear out, but there are a couple of road signs (road closure and permit parking) by the entrance to Pittville Park between 15 and 17 Marle Hill Road GL50 4LN
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Uncleared leaves causing flooding, 9th September
item.description:
The leaves are flowing down from Sydenham Road North and Princes Street to the corner of Victoria Terrace and causing flooding across Victoria Terrace so it rises above the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Princes Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 9th September
item.description:

item.title: Fallen tree over footpath near railway line, 9th September

item.title: Water pools on road surface, 8th September
item.description:
In heavy rain, water pools at the end of athelnay way at the Hales Road Junction. IT pools as the road surface is below the level of the drains. Recent roadworks have not resolved the issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Athelney Way, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road markings, lines and stud issues problem, 8th September
item.description:
Customer had called in and had mentioned that the lines need to be repainted and made clearer as she has had a few incidents where peole almost hit them/ use the wrong lanes and it cause a few issues on the road thi has happened even when she has learner drivers with her as well. she is wondering if this can be looked into.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
